column1: Savda is a city and a municipal council in Jalgaon district in the Indian state of Maharashtra. It is also known as Banana City for production of bananas at a good scale.
Savda is located at 21.15°N 75.88°E﻿ / 21.15; 75.88. It has an average elevation of 231 metres (757 feet).

column3: 331. Males constitute 52% of the population and females 48%. Savda has an average literacy rate of 72%
column4: lower than the national average of 74.5%: male literacy is 78%
column5: and female literacy is 65%. In Savda
column6: 13% of the population is under 6 years of age. Freedom Fighters from Savda had fought in the Quit India Movement of 1942.
